post_text: NEWS FROM THE ATHLETIC DEPT.: Due to the Ohio Department of Health’s social distancing guidelines, parent’s night, Friday, September 11th will be different this year for football players and cheerleaders. In order to keep our athletes on the field for their entire season, we are asking only seniors and their escorts be permitted to walk the field. The underclassmen names will be read over the PA; however, the athletic department is asking their escorts to remain in the bleachers. We understand this is not ideal; however, we all want to do what is best for our athlete’s health, safety, and sport. We appreciate your support of our senior athletes and the Athletic Department, as we do our part to help the season continue for all of our athletes.

So much has changed since the Elida High school Musical production went dark in mid-March due to the pandemic.
What has NOT changed is the enthusiasm and commitment of the Elida students, parents, directors, and school administration to bring this show to life as soon as we have the “green light”.
The dream lives on! The next projected performance run for the show is planned for the first or second weekend of August. If we are still unable to open in August, the show will be moved into the fall scheduling. We hope to still include all graduating Seniors who were originally part of the show. As soon as we have confirmed dates we will exchange tickets for all those still holding tickets from the earlier scheduled performance run. If you are unable to attend the show at its future time, please contact Rhonda Bargerstock in August and we will refund your ticket purchase. We look forward to the day soon when we can tell this wonderful story with music, movement, color and heart!
